question: A 7 years old child from Bihar is having hypo pigmented anesthetic patch on his face. What is the most probable diagnosis?
exp: ANSWER: (A) Intermediate leprosy. REF: Rook's Dermatology 7th edp. 29. 1-29. 19. Recurrent scaly hypopigmented macule on face of a child - P. alba. Recurrent scaly hypopigmented macule on face of an adult - P. versicolor. Resident of endemic zone with anesthetic patch over face - Indeterminate leprosy

question: Salt and pepper skin is seen in?
